bug.title: Predicate Validation
bug.body: Mead reported that the tool is generating incorrect predicate errors. I also tested other predicates, there is definitely something wrong with the evaluation of the predicates. The message segment seems to be valid. The message segment: OBX|13|NM|83846-6^MothersHeight^LN||62|in^Inches^UCUM|||||F Error generated by validation: The Field OBX-6 (Units) is present whereas it is an unsupported element (Usage = X). The element is not supported based on the condition predicate evaluation: If the value of OBX-6.1 is one of list values: 83846-6,56077-1,8339-4,69461-2,87296-0,11884-4,85724-3,87298-6,87299-4,64794-1,64795-8. -- Here is the XML: <Segment><ByID ID="OBX_BR_2-6"><Predicate ID="CP_6[1]_0" Target="6[1]" TrueUsage="R" FalseUsage="X"><Description>If the value of OBX-6.1 is one of list values: 83846-6,56077-1,8339-4,69461-2,87296-0,11884-4,85724-3,87298-6,87299-4,64794-1,64795-8.</Description><Condition><AND><Presence Path="6[1].1[1]"/><StringList Path="6[1].1[1]" CSV="83846-6,56077-1,8339-4,69461-2,87296-0,11884-4,85724-3,87298-6,87299-4,64794-1,64795-8"/></AND></Condition></Predicate></ByID>

bug.title: Order of segments in IG style export is not alphabetical
bug.body: When I export in IG style, the list of segments is not what I expected. I would have expected it to be in alphabetical order. I sort of looks like they are being exported in the order of appearance in profiles, but I think it makes more sense to be alphabetical given that some profiles use the same segments but profiles sometimes use different flavors of segment. For example, I think it makes more sense for the two OBX segment flavors to be groups in the segment section. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17408249/29525977-f65b89ce-8659-11e7-92ef-0e01ae93c2ca.png) I think in profile export mode, it does make sense to export them in the order in which they appear in the message definition.

bug.body: Make a change in a data type library but then, without saving, go back to the Data Type Library List using the button in the upper left hand corner (green box below) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24863416/5333d540-1dc6-11e7-8bd0-1706057ce6d6.png) And then open a different data type library ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24863459/8a28751a-1dc6-11e7-899a-389d604e4c2b.png) And then go back to the original data type library and the change will not be there. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24863491/acfb3776-1dc6-11e7-807d-52123d73d23f.png) The easiest solution is probably to add the standard "save changes" pop up that you get other places when you go back to the Data Type Library List ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24863551/e485e380-1dc6-11e7-99b1-695d9152efba.png) Note that you can do a similar workflow in the IG document activity. The system responses similarly other than when you go to open the second document you get that confirmation popup so that the changes are not lost. that is a good thing, but I think it would be better if that popup showed up as you're changing to the IG document list (so earlier than it is now) and not when going to a new document (at which point there is no context for the author to decided which change is being referred to.

bug.title: Value set missing from Export
bug.body: Per Mead: "I note that one of my value sets –birth and fetal death financial class – did not make it into the export. It is referred to be a field within NK1, not by an observation." SM: Is reference by FC_BR DT and the Optional PV1_BR-20

bug.title: "optional" value sets being exported
bug.body: Even when the value set export configurations are as stripped down as the can get (only the default R, RE and C value sets), many extraneous value sets are still in the export (a few are highlighted with the red arrows below). These are just value sets the author will have to manually remove. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24054204/6eeda7cc-0b09-11e7-8e5d-c67cae402747.png) It seems like the value sets are included because they have a usage of R, RE or C somewhere, even if the place they are used are itself optional. For example, value set 0004 is required in PV1-2 even though that segment is in an optional (patient visit) segment group (although PV1 is R within that optional segment group). ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24054363/ebbe0d6e-0b09-11e7-9085-4562ad4c5de4.png) Similarly, value set 0051 is required in a totally optional segment (DG1) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24054405/10a61c3e-0b0a-11e7-8455-c815c644deb4.png) I'm assuming table 0113 is included in the export because it is required in one of the places it's used (the DLD data type) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24054069/f4ac03fa-0b08-11e7-808e-b2bc1e4191ac.png) Interestingly, the DLD data type is only optional everywhere it's used: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/24054017/c8f1f30a-0b08-11e7-917b-e46f8913f6ec.png) Overall, the export is still including value sets that are in some way, shape or form optional everywhere they are used. In my IG, I'm letting the document be silent on any element that is ultimately optional (keeps the size of the document manageable) and having these extra value sets is just more manual work that needs to be done. I'm not sure what the solution here is. It may be to add a configuration to filter out value sets that are only used in data types/fields which are ultimately optional (this could be rather complex given how the building blocks of the HL7 message are put together) or it could be just an option to only export custom data types and filter out all HL7 base value sets (although this only works if we have a best practice to always use a custom value set anywhere that a value set is bound). This topic probably warrants more discussion on a call.

bug.title: "code" format doesn't export well
bug.body: When formatting text as "code" it is possible to use multiple lines in the formatted text, but when the text is exported, the line breaks are just represented by a "?" and the lines run together. It's not easy to enter multiple lines in a code formatted text section, but there are a number of different way to do it, so if authors can do it, the export needs to be able to support it. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22222628/39b179d6-e17d-11e6-9525-ca152e499849.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22222561/f84cc93c-e17c-11e6-8cef-52a8294130a0.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22222602/1f98812a-e17d-11e6-8ca7-3de9f2f0e111.png)

bug.title: data type name format
bug.body: Sorry if this is a duplicate. I feel like we discussed it before. I think the convention is that data type element identifiers are the data type, a period and then the sequence ID. So the first component of CWE is CWE.1. In the current exports a dash is used rather than a period. Also note that in the export, there is no space between the data type element name (CWE-1) and the colon separator and the description (Identifier). This makes it a bit difficult to read and Microsoft Word questions it (blue underlining). It would be better if there was more white space (see the second screenshot below to see how it looks in the segment section) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22216478/dd7b2d00-e164-11e6-9cc8-4b863fad8185.png) The convention for segment elements is the segment name, a dash and then the element number. So the first field in PID is PID-1. The export use the right bits and pieces, but seems to have extra space between them (PID - 1 as opposed to PID-1). ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22216589/495ed63e-e165-11e6-845d-c92c8cc9d073.png)

bug.title: section number breaks down in the Conformance Profile section
bug.body: When exporting the conformance profile section in verbose mode, the number of the sections is off. When Pre-Definition text exists for a segment, it gets moved up in the section hierarchy rather than down. In the example below, the Pre-Definition text for the QPD_IZ segment should be section 3.1.11.3.7.1 rather than 3.1.11.4 (it should not be at the same level as the "Segment Definitions" section. If going down 6 levels deep is too much, it would probably be OK just to have the text above the segment table without any section number. Given that the table and the field Definition Text don't have their own sections, maybe not assigning a subsection to Pre-Definition text is the best way to go ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22211997/a3c391ca-e154-11e6-90a7-0b2107c6d9ae.png)

bug.title: Cardinality and Usage shouldn't be populated for the END of a segment group
bug.body: In the message definition tables, when there is a segment group, it is critical to include a cardinality and usage at the start of the segment group, but there is no need to include the same information at the end of the segment (see red box below). It will just confuse readers. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22211136/bcb46450-e151-11e6-8872-01f0d9a4c1b0.png) I think it should look like this: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/22211309/3f7643a4-e152-11e6-8db9-10e8ac4a8351.png)

bug.body: The Word export doesn't seem to include segment groups that are nested in other segment groups. Not only are the segment groups (and the segments in them) not in the message definition table, the segments are also not included following the message definition table in the verbose format For example, in the screen shot below, there are first level segment groups (like insurance (green arrow)) and second level segment groups (timing and observation within the Order segment group (red arrow)) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21970408/95792d26-db6b-11e6-9ba0-57dc846b9fca.png) The insurance segment group is in the export (green arrow below) but neither Timing nor Observation (red arrows). ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21970460/2d14c668-db6c-11e6-9cc1-0d9f0138de57.png)

bug.title: Can't export profiles
bug.body: I wanted to export a profile so that I could import it in to the validation tool but when I right click Conformance Profile and select Export, nothing happens. Long term, will it be the Conformance Profile or the Composite Profiles that should be exportable?

bug.title: exporting only custom data type flavors?

bug.title: Message Infrastructure organization issues for verbose mode
bug.body: The organization of the Message Infrastructure section needs a bit of work in Verbose mode. I would expect something like: 3 Message Infrastructure 3.1 Conformance Profiles 3.1.1 QBP^Q11 3.1.1.1 Usage Note 3.1.1.2 Pre-definition 3.1.1.3 Message Definition <including Conditional Predicates and Conformance Statements> 3.1.1.4 Post-defintion 3.1.1.5 Segment definitions 3.1.1.5.1 MSH 3.1.1.5.2 SFT 3.1.1.5.X<remaining segments> 3.1.2 RSP^K11 3.1.2.1 Usage Note 3.1.2.2 Pre-definition 3.1.2.3 Message Definition <including Conditional Predicates and Conformance Statements> 3.1.2.4 Post-defintion 3.1.2.5 Segment definitions 3.1.2.5.1 MSH 3.1.2.5.2 SFT 3.1.2.5.X<remaining segments> If you think it's too many levels to get down to 3.1.1.5.1 as the MSH segment, rather than having "segment definition" wrapper level, just having the segments be 3.1.1.6 (MSH), 3.1.1.7 (SFT), etc would be fine. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21821655/04139306-d73a-11e6-9404-0e46c98afd34.png)

bug.title: odd order of conformance statements at the end of the Word document
bug.body: In the final section of the exported Word document, all the conformance statements and conditional predicates are listed. For some reason for the conformance statements for the conformance profiles, the order is reversed from what I would expect. In IGAMT, the QBP is first and the RSP is second but in section 3.5, the order is reversed. It doesn't seem to be the conformance ID as IZ-2 is first. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21821266/8685a4de-d738-11e6-9bac-7737e6779ebc.png)

bug.title: inconsistent format when referring to a data type element
bug.body: you are inconsistent in how you refer to a data type element. In just this small space you use a dash (blue arrow), period (green arrow) and nothing (red arrow) between the data type (CWE) and the element number I believe the accepted convention is to use the period for a data type (eg. CWE.4) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21819838/ee76beb2-d732-11e6-9e7b-7525924ea920.png)

bug.title: repeating conditional predicate
bug.body: Same issue here as for the conformance statements. The single conditional predicate is repeating multiple times in the Word export. As well, the table headers are off (and one short). It seems like they should be "Location", "Usage" and "Description". Finally, is there a reason by "predicate" is not capitalized (it is in IGAMT)? similarly, in the section before this one "statement" in "Conformance statement" is not capitalized. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21818505/b7c60d5a-d72d-11e6-9104-f67fe5d651d4.png)

Now: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21812429/8ab34310-d718-11e6-8b9f-224bcd062899.png) Should be more like this: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21812504/c794ec3e-d718-11e6-867a-39466b1f3c4f.png)

bug.title: Export sometimes misses a space
bug.body: If an author applies fomatting to part of a line, after the formatting ends, 1 space is removed between the formatted and unformatted text. In the examples below, if the first word of a line is either bold or italic, the space after the formatting ends is missing in the Word export. Oddly, underlining is not affected. If the whole line is formatted, then the spacing is just fine. If multiple spaces are included in the line, it seems like only a single space is lost (not all of them) This may see a bit obscure, but I use this format in the immunization guide to call attention to a header. I'm using the "dev" flag, but this is occurring in the production IGAMT too. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21812041/4fd2b98e-d717-11e6-9076-b846c2538f63.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/21812002/33088054-d717-11e6-8f77-8c85ddd083c1.png)

bug.title: Compact Word export has blank pages
bug.body: When I exported my IG to the compact Word format, there are two blank pages between the title page and the first page of content. at least one of these should be removed unless they serve a clear purpose (some documents intentionally include a blank page but they label is "intentionally blank").

bug.title: export shouldn't include "null" metadata
bug.body: When I created my test IG, I didn't enter a lot of metadata, but some authors won't want to include a Sub-Title or Organization. bug.title: export gets truncated
bug.body: Even though the text in IGAMT looks OK, there are two places in my IG where the export gets truncated. The first spot is in section 1.4.5 which looks like this in IGAMT: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20566994/b1f6c334-b15c-11e6-9ed4-b19525b7b5cc.png) And the export ends here: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567035/dcb13a3c-b15c-11e6-8883-b6b3ff5d1e0b.png) If you go into IGAMT and replace the current text between the tables with an identical copy, then the export works: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567238/a0b51700-b15d-11e6-97c3-523b5afce13c.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567258/afff5acc-b15d-11e6-81a2-70b016c37fde.png) The second place where the export truncates is in section 2.3.7.11 in the middle of the word "Local". In IGAMT it looks like this: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567359/fcabff7e-b15d-11e6-9ad5-d2978b93ab90.png) And the export looks like this: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567385/17eefb24-b15e-11e6-92ae-c079339299eb.png) If you go into IGAMT and replace the word "Local" the issue is fixed: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567474/6ed348a0-b15e-11e6-99a4-505bd1091d9d.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20567456/62214a76-b15e-11e6-8273-3243d12846d0.png) My guess is that there are unprintable characters in there that are causing the export to truncate without an error but I sure can't find them. I've created copies of my IG so that the development team can take a look and will share them with Harold. They will be labeled "before" and "after". "before" has the truncating issue, the "after" has been fixed and successfully exported.

bug.title: Issues with Date Updated
bug.body: There seems to be some trouble with the individual Date Updated field of the IG components. On the Metadata tab, the Date Updated value has a couple of issues: 1) it doesn't update, even when data is changed (see example below) 2) the field doesn't seem to be editable (which makes sense), but it isn't greyed out (like HL7 Version is), so it seems like an author should be able to update it. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20564396/ba4c365e-b152-11e6-8443-890e2c959587.png) In other tabs, the Date Updated field starts out OK (in the example below, it starts out as the date/time when I copied the IG), but when I update the Contents, the Date Updated reverts to an earlier date (the one on the Metadata tab presumably) rather than updating to the current date/time Before the change: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20564455/07f837ae-b153-11e6-9e12-ac2ac49c8787.png) After the change: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/20564488/234537dc-b153-11e6-80a5-890a43cf4468.png)

bug.title: Inappropriate value set association possibilities
bug.body: When creating custom fields for a segment (such as QPD), the segment editor will allow the author to associate value sets with some inappropriate data types. In the example below, you can add a value set to NM_01 and DTM_01 (purple box) but not DTM (red box). The latter is appropriate, the former are inappropriate. The tool should only allow value sets to be associated with logical data types (and their related flavors). ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/18062672/6f32258c-6ded-11e6-825a-ca1f0c5b1629.png)

Either way, either the Save button needs to light up or the confirmation box needs to go away so it consistently reflects what has to happen for the text change to persist

bug.title: Export of Data Types
bug.body: It appears the only data types exported in the Word document are the user defined data types. In the examples below there are examples of: - custom data types (red box) - standard complex data type (purple box) - "varies" data type (blue box) - standard atomic data type (black box) Of these only the custom data type seems to make it into the exported IG. The purple box is my fault (it should have a custom data type), but the blue and black boxes are scenarios where the data type needs to be in the IG. In general, is there any reason not to export the data type regardless of whether or not it's custom or standard? ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/17631223/d61cbf04-6088-11e6-846b-416a7aff03d2.png) ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/17631201/af0c1dce-6088-11e6-8e2e-675c4b1891f6.png)

From the editor: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/13708593/20a171c4-e775-11e5-8e2a-c6ae777df64d.png) From the PDF format: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/13708605/30130f78-e775-11e5-9d27-71a74c601534.png) From the HTML format: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/13708682/97e328ea-e775-11e5-827d-25af1fd3ad6d.png) From the Word format: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17408249/13708809/292eb9cc-e776-11e5-8418-91e56190d98b.png)

bug.title: Data type flavors replacing base DT in optional elements
bug.body: Added HD_VR_AA flavor, the tool changed all the HD data types to this flavors including the HD_VR that I created and also the the DT in the Optional fields.

bug.title: IMPORT HL7 DB 2.7.1 and 2.8 Received from Rob
Collapsing Conformance Profiles node does not hide the conformance profiles sometimes
text editor closes unexpectedly
bug.body: The editor window will close unexpectedly. Type some text and then use the mouse to highlight some text. Without releasing the left mouse button, drag the cursor so that it is outside of the text box. When you release the mouse button, the editor window closes. It seems to save any changes, but it's odd behavior.

bug.title: ToC open/close icons have stopped displaying properly with the change to IGDocument structure.
Fix delete message (conformance profile)
bug.body: - Need to remove dead segment, datatype, valueSets etc...

bug.title: Fix Create IG
bug.body: - Set the User Creating the IG in the newly created IG.

bug.title: Delete IG from user list: if current IG delete from edit area.
When items are selected int he ToC, highlighting does not extend the full with of the item's text.
bug.body: Fixed. Highlighting now extends for 400px, which should be sufficient.

bug.title: The IG list is not being populated from the db. Suspect the newly created IG is not being saved.
bug.body: Done IG was indeed being saved, but sans an accountId. The REST method for save was throwing an error when the accountId was null. ProfileController.save... was calling findProfile(id); the return value was not being used. Call has been removed. We now set the accountId in the js during the save function.

bug.title: IG edit form fields are not all synching with the visible fields in the IG list.
bug.body: Done IG list fields were bound to the wrong fields in the model.
